text: Sergio González Rodríguez (26 January 1950 – 3 April 2017) was a Mexican journalist and writer. He was born in Mexico City. He was best known for his works on the murders of women in Ciudad Juárez in the 1990s to 2000s, such as Huesos en el desierto (Bones in the desert) published in 2002. Rodríguez also wrote novels, essays, screenplays for documentaries and was recognized with several awards in Mexico and Spain. Rodríguez died of a heart attack in Mexico City on 3 April 2017, aged 67. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1950 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Mexican journalists Category:Mexican novelists Category:Mexican screenwriters Category:Mexican historians Category:Mexican essayists Category:Writers from Mexico City
